DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim research evaluate community-based exercise ( CBE ) intervention adult live HIV within community goal reduce disability enhance health ( cardiopulmonary , strength , weight body composition , neurocognitive outcome ) contextual factor outcome ( social support , stigma , mastery , cop ) adult live HIV .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluating Community-Based Exercise Intervention With Adults Living With HIV : An Interrupted Time Series Study
DOC.detailed_description: Investigators use RE-AIM Framework evaluate community-based exercise ( CBE ) intervention . The RE-AIM Framework include criterion evaluate impact translation intervention individual organizational-levels order promote uptake , transferability ultimately enhance public health impact health promotion intervention . Specific study objective : 1 ) To determine extent ( proportion session attend , frequency , intensity , time , type ) adult HIV participate CBE intervention ; 2 ) To assess effect CBE intervention disability health outcome intrinsic extrinsic factor outcome people live HIV ; 3 ) To assess engagement CBE adult HIV time ( adherence , level physical activity ) ; 4 ) To evaluate process ( strengths challenge ; feasibility ; accessibility , long term sustainability ) implement CBE intervention within community perspective recreation provider ( fitness instructor ; manager ) people live HIV . Investigators conduct prospective longitudinal study use mixed method evaluate CBE intervention community people live HIV . They use interrupted time series ( ITS ) design combination qualitative interview assess outcomes baseline ( pre-testing phase ) , ( intervention phase ) CBE intervention ( post-testing phase ) evaluate short- long-term effect CBE .
DOC.criteria: Adults ( 18 year old ) live HIV Toronto consider medically stable safe engage exercise willing participate 22 month study involve 14 month CBE intervention YMCA .
